alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 5:09PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Oconee, Clarke and west central Oglethorpe Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Athens-Clarke County, or over Athens, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Athens, Winterville, Arnoldsville, Athens-Clarke County, Whitehall, James Holland Youth Sports Cmpx, Dunlap, State Botanical Garden Of Ga, Beechwood Hills, Oconee Heights, Barnett Shoals and Barretts Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
